description: An educator uploads a cybersecurity fundamentals PDF, and the platform automatically extracts concepts, creates an interactive video SCORM module, generates multiple‑choice quizzes, validates the package, and provides a download link.

messages.content: You are EduScormBuilder, an agentic LLM that helps educators turn teaching materials into SCORM‑compatible e‑learning modules using the provided toolkit.
I have a PDF guide on cybersecurity fundamentals. Can you turn it into an interactive video SCORM module with risk‑assessment quizzes?
Absolutely! Please upload the PDF file so I can start processing it.
Got the PDF. I’ll extract the plain text so we can analyse it.
{"text": "Chapter 1: Introduction to Cybersecurity... Threats include malware, phishing, ransomware, DDoS attacks. Chapter 2: Risk Management...", "page_count": 42}
Analyzing the extracted text to identify the core concepts and learning objectives.

arguments.text: Chapter 1: Introduction to Cybersecurity... Threats include malware, phishing, ransomware, DDoS attacks. Chapter 2: Risk Management...

messages.content: Fetching an interactive‑video SCORM template that supports embedded video and checkpoint quizzes.
Generating a set of multiple‑choice assessment items based on the identified concepts.

{"assessment": [{"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "Which of the following is a type of ransomware?", "options": ["WannaCry", "Spyware", "Adware", "Keylogger"], "answer": "WannaCry"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "What is the primary goal of phishing attacks?", "options": ["Data exfiltration", "System reboot", "Network segmentation", "Hardware upgrade"], "answer": "Data exfiltration"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "Which security control helps mitigate DDoS attacks?", "options": ["Firewalls", "Antivirus", "Load balancers", "Encryption"], "answer": "Load balancers"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "In risk assessment, what does the term 'likelihood' refer to?", "options": ["Potential impact", "Probability of occurrence", "Cost of mitigation", "Regulatory compliance"], "answer": "Probability of occurrence"}, {"type": "multiple_choice", "question": "Which phase comes first in the incident response lifecycle?", "options": ["Containment", "Eradication", "Preparation", "Recovery"], "answer": "Preparation"} ]}
Creating slide content for each concept and embedding the assessment as checkpoints.

slides.title: Malware
slides.html_body:
Malware

Malware is malicious software designed to damage, disrupt, or gain unauthorized access to computer systems.

slides.title: Phishing
slides.html_body:
Phishing

Phishing attacks attempt to trick users into revealing sensitive information by masquerading as trustworthy entities.

slides.title: Ransomware
slides.html_body:
Ransomware

Ransomware encrypts victim files and demands payment for the decryption key.

slides.title: DDoS Attacks
slides.html_body:
DDoS Attacks

Distributed Denial‑of‑Service attacks overwhelm a target with massive traffic, rendering services unavailable.

slides.title: Risk Assessment
slides.html_body:
Risk Assessment

Risk assessment involves identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing risks to an organization’s assets.

assessment.question: Which of the following is a type of ransomware?
What is the primary goal of phishing attacks?
Which security control helps mitigate DDoS attacks?
In risk assessment, what does the term 'likelihood' refer to?
Which phase comes first in the incident response lifecycle?

messages.content: Running SCORM compliance validation on the generated package.
Storing the validated SCORM package and generating a public download link.

All done! Your interactive video SCORM module is ready and has passed validation. You can download it here:
https://scorm-storage.example.com/modules/Cybersecurity_Fundamentals_Interactive.zip

The module contains five slides covering key cybersecurity concepts and a set of five multiple‑choice quiz items that will appear as checkpoints during the video. Feel free to import the zip into any LMS that supports SCORM 1.2 or 2004.
